article.headline: VA Commonwealth 82, American 76 (OT)
article.story: RICHMOND, Va. (AP) -- B.A. Walker scored nine of his 27 points in overtime Monday night and Virginia Commonwealth beat American 82-76 in the Preseason NIT. The Rams (1-0) earned a another shot at No. 2 Wake Forest, which beat VCU 79-78 last year in the first round of the NCAA tournament, on Thursday night in Winston-Salem, N.C. The Demon Deacons beat George Washington 97-76 in their season-opener. Walker scored seven points in the first 2:05 of the overtime as the Rams pulled away, continuing the momentum that allowed them to tie the game after a slow start. Walker's overtime burst made it 75-69 and the Eagles got no closer than four thereafter. Former Highland Springs High School star Andre Ingram set a Siegel Center record with 38 points, and had 18 in the first half as the Eagles (0-1) led 36-24 by halftime. VCU used defense to fuel a 20-8 run in the first 10 minutes of the second half, tying the game at 44. American had just seven shots and five turnovers during the run. After the Eagles scored nine straight to take a 58-51 lead with 4:40 left, the Rams rallied again, taking their first lead on Walker's layup with 39.5 seconds to go. A jumper by Jason Thomas gave American a 64-63 lead with 23.5 seconds to go, but Nick George hit a 3-pointer for the Rams with 8.8 seconds left, and Ingram sent the game to overtime when he banked in a 12-footer with five-tenths of a second to play. George had 24 points for the Rams, all after halftime, and Calvin Roland added 10. The Rams also learned that they will be without Michael Doles, their top returning scorer (11.2 points) for an indefinite period as he recovers from mononucleosis. Matej Cresnik added 13 points for the Eagles.
